title: Authors and Citation
text: Mezquita D (2024). Logger: Flexible Customisable Logging System R. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/dereckmezquita/R-Logger.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Logger: Flexible and Customisable Logging System for R},   author = {Dereck Mezquita},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/dereckmezquita/R-Logger}, }

what: Flexible and Customisable Logging System for R
title: Flexible and Customisable Logging System for R
Log Levels — LogLevel
text: Defines available log levels Logger class.

title: Logger — Logger
text: R6 class flexible logging customizable output.

title: Logger — Logger
text: Logger$new() Logger$set_level() Logger$error() Logger$warn() Logger$info() Logger$clone()

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$new(   level = LogLevel$INFO,   save_to_file = FALSE,   file_path = "",   print_fn = function(x) cat(x, "\n") )

title: Logger — Logger
text: level minimum log level output. Default LogLevel$INFO. save_to_file Logical; whether save logs file. Default FALSE. file_path Character; path log file save_to_file TRUE. print_fn Function; custom print function use console output. accept single character string input. Default uses cat newline.

title: Logger — Logger
code: logger <- Logger$new(level = LogLevel$WARNING, save_to_file = TRUE, file_path = "log.txt")

title: Logger — Logger
text: level new minimum log level set.

title: Logger — Logger
text: msg Character; error message log. data Optional; additional data include log entry. error Optional; error object include log entry.

title: Logger — Logger
code: logger <- Logger$new() logger$error("An error occurred", data = list(x = 1), error = simpleError("Oops!"))

title: Logger — Logger
text: msg Character; warning message log. data Optional; additional data include log entry.

title: Logger — Logger
code: logger <- Logger$new() logger$warn("This is a warning", data = list(reason = "example"))

title: Logger — Logger
text: msg Character; info message log. data Optional; additional data include log entry.

title: Logger — Logger
code: logger <- Logger$new() logger$info("Operation completed successfully", data = list(duration = 5.2))

title: Logger — Logger
code: # Create a basic logger logger <- Logger$new() logger$info("This is an info message") #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.827Z INFO    This is an info message  logger$warn("This is a warning") #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.832Z WARNING This is a warning  logger$error("This is an error") #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.841Z ERROR   This is an error   # Create a logger with custom settings custom_logger <- Logger$new(   level = LogLevel$WARNING,   save_to_file = TRUE,   file_path = tempfile("log_"),   print_fn = message ) custom_logger$info("This won't be logged") custom_logger$warn("This will be logged") #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.846Z WARNING This will be logged  # Change log level custom_logger$set_level(LogLevel$INFO) custom_logger$info("Now this will be logged") #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.855Z INFO    Now this will be logged  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `Logger$new` ## ------------------------------------------------  logger <- Logger$new(level = LogLevel$WARNING, save_to_file = TRUE, file_path = "log.txt")  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `Logger$set_level` ## ------------------------------------------------  logger <- Logger$new() logger$set_level(LogLevel$WARNING)  ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `Logger$error` ## ------------------------------------------------  logger <- Logger$new() logger$error("An error occurred", data = list(x = 1), error = simpleError("Oops!")) #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.861Z ERROR   An error occurred #> Data: #> { #>   "x": 1 #> } #> Error: #> { #>   "name": "simpleError", #>   "message": "Oops!", #>   "call": "NULL" #> }   ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `Logger$warn` ## ------------------------------------------------  logger <- Logger$new() logger$warn("This is a warning", data = list(reason = "example")) #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.864Z WARNING This is a warning #> Data: #> { #>   "reason": "example" #> }   ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `Logger$info` ## ------------------------------------------------  logger <- Logger$new() logger$info("Operation completed successfully", data = list(duration = 5.2)) #> 2024-08-03T13:50:02.866Z INFO    Operation completed successfully #> Data: #> { #>   "duration": 5.2 #> }
